title: STEM Developments: A Versatile Light Injector/Collector, Fast 4D-STEM, and High Energy Resolution EELS without Compromising Beam Current
content: The capabilities of STEM have advanced tremendously in recent years. A modern STEM can now deliver atomic-level spatial resolution (1.1 Ã…) and phonon-detecting energy resolution (2.6 meV) at 20 keV primary energy [1]. These capabilities come from advanced electron-optical instrumentation, such as monochromators, correctors, and spectrometers. In parallel developments, many researchers are turning attention to combining advanced electron-optical capabilities with new developments, such as sample stimuli, detectors, software, and operating modes. We illustrate this progress in three directions: a new light injector/collector, fast 4D-STEM, and high energy resolution EELS beyond the traditional monochromated current limit.
